identificationModule.briefTitle: Validation of a Food Frequency Questionnaire: VioScreen
identificationModule.officialTitle: Validation of a Food Frequency Questionnaire: VioScreen

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to learn more about how well a questionnaire about food intake works. The study team will compare questionnaire responses to several other measurements of food intake. There is a special emphasis on fruit and vegetable intake.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Concurrent validity of VioScreen against 24-hour recalls
primaryOutcomes.description: Concurrent validity measures how a new test compares against a validated test, called the criterion or "gold standard."
Test-retest reliability is a measure of reliability obtained by administering the same test twice over a period of time to a group of individuals.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Concurrent validity of VioScreen against Veggie Meter
secondaryOutcomes.description: Concurrent validity measures how a new test compares against a validated test, called the criterion or "gold standard."

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Concurrent validity of VioScreen against Fruit and Vegetable Screener
secondaryOutcomes.description: Concurrent validity measures how a new test compares against a validated test, called the criterion or "gold standard."
Test-retest reliability is a measure of reliability obtained by administering the same test twice over a period of time to a group of individuals.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Test-retest reliability of Fruit and Vegetable Screener
secondaryOutcomes.description: Test-retest reliability is a measure of reliability obtained by administering the same test twice over a period of time to a group of individuals.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Concurrent validity of Veggie Meter against 24-hour recalls
secondaryOutcomes.description: Concurrent validity measures how a new test compares against a validated test, called the criterion or "gold standard."

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Concurrent validity of Fruit and Vegetable Screener against 24-hour recalls
secondaryOutcomes.description: Concurrent validity measures how a new test compares against a validated test, called the criterion or "gold standard."

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age 18-40 as we are aiming to recruit women of child-bearing age
* Pregnant women up to 26 weeks' gestation
* Women assigned female sex at birth who are not pregnant

Exclusion Criteria:

* Women below the age of 18 or over the age of 40 years
* Pregnant women more than 26 weeks' gestation at the time of enrollment
* Women who are experiencing limited or reduced food intake related to nausea will not be approached for recruitment and are considered ineligible
* Women who are unwilling to participate in the study due to time commitment or other reasons
* Women whose capacity for study compliance is diminished due to conditions such as active untreated substance use disorder, untreated/uncontrolled schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, active psychosis will not be approached for recruitment and are considered ineligible
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: pregnant women and women of child-bearing age
